content:
That's a fantastic plan! By setting a clear limit on your gaming/TV time and scheduling a wind-down session, you'll be able to create a buffer between your stimulating activities and bedtime. This will help signal to your brain that it's time to relax and prepare for sleep.

Communicating with your friends is also a great idea. It's possible that they might not even realize the impact that late-night gaming sessions have on your sleep, and they might be willing to adjust their schedules to accommodate your needs.

Remember to be kind to yourself as you make these changes. It might take a few weeks for your body to adjust to the new routine, so don't get discouraged if you don't see immediate results. Keep in mind that small, consistent changes can add up over time and lead to significant improvements in your sleep quality and overall well-being.

To help you stay on track, I recommend setting reminders for your wind-down session and bedtime, just like you did for your morning routine. This will help you stay committed to your new schedule and make it easier to establish a consistent sleep routine.

How do you feel about tracking your progress and reflecting on how these changes are affecting your sleep and daily life? Would you like to set up a system to monitor your progress and make adjustments as needed?
